alert.note: Alert for Kiowa; Prowers (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued December 02 at 1:25PM MST until December 02 at 3:15PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Prowers County in southeastern Colorado... Eastern Kiowa County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 315 PM MST. * At 119 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 12 miles north of Sharon Springs to 6 miles northwest of Weskan to near Cheyenne Wells to 15 miles east of Kit Carson to 7 miles east of Boyero, moving south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Near zero visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Satellite. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * A wall of dust is currently dropping south into Kiowa County, and will progress south across Prowers County. Winds will shift from westerly to northerly with the wall of dust. Near zero visibility will impact Highways 287, 50 and 385. Locations impacted include... Lamar, Holly, Eads, Granada, Sheridan Lake, Hartman, Neeoshe Reservoir, Chivington, Brandon, Towner, Bristol, Sweetwater Reservoir, Queens Reservoir and Neegronda Reservoir. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
